body.p:
Midway Feby 15" 65
Gov. Bramlette
Dear Sir

I trouble you with a line in regard to the recruiting officer for the State Service at this place who professes to have authority -- from you to raise a company &c, I refer to W. W. Harper -- and as a citizen and a Union man in behalf of the cause -- the community, your own good name and of common decency I protest against such an appointment -- As badly as this service demands men and as much as we have
suffered from guerrillas we as a community had rather Quantrell, would pay an occasional visit than be annoyed by this man in "brief authority" -- all the time.
This is not malice -- I am one of the very few who are on friendly terms with Harper in town, but in Heavens name dont give any such man a commission.
I do not think he caught a single recruit yet assuming authority from you damages the cause very much with decent people

I do not care to have my name known in this tho if necessary I shall not shrink from it one jot -- but he is
not the kind of man to have in the place nor a desirable enemy.
Col McLeod or W, Y, Poynter can represent his case to you

Very Truly Yrs &c
M. E, Poynter

Midway Ky
February 15th 1865
Poynter M. E
To Gov. B --

Asks in the name of heaven &c that the authority of W. W Harper at that place be revoked -- as he is unfit, & will damage the cause -- refers to W. T. Poynter and Col McLeod -- member from Woodford Co --

L B No. 10. 1865 P 113
Recd A. G. O. Feby 16" 1865
